sentences.english: During my childhood days, house doors could be left ajar at night.
sentences.chinese: 兒時的鄉村，是可以夜不閉戶的。

sentences.english: It is those lines of foot-prints that are weaved into fairy tales of my childhood.
sentences.chinese: 那一行行的腳印編織了我兒時春天的童話。

sentences.english: One day she sets off to find her long-lost childhood friend.
sentences.chinese: 某天，她去尋找許久不見的兒時同伴。

sentences.english: As often as he tried to go there, he always failed.
sentences.chinese: 每當他想去那兒時，結果總是去不成。

sentences.english: Just as a child and picked up the dandelion to be fine.
sentences.chinese: 就像兒時，拿起蒲公英的細須。

sentences.english: Lifted his eyes to the heavens, and, folding his hands as in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他擡眼看着天空，合起雙手，像兒時那樣。

sentences.english: But the war did come. I saw my boyhood friends blown to bits.
sentences.chinese: 但戰爭來了，我親眼看到我兒時的夥伴們被炸成碎片。

sentences.english: And he has fallen like Lucifer, never to rise again.
sentences.chinese: 他兒時的夢想象曉星一樣墜落，註定不會再度升起。

sentences.english: The fields where I played as a child have been built over.
sentences.chinese: 我兒時玩耍的那些田野現在已蓋滿了高樓大廈。

sentences.english: One of the first games I ever learned to play as a child was Tic Tac Toe.
sentences.chinese: 我兒時學會的第一個遊戲是井字遊戲。

sentences.english: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 父母過於愛面子的做法在他兒時一直困擾着他。

sentences.english: The man had once been Aunt Cordelia's sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 她是約翰兒時的心上人。

sentences.english: Being a child I used to start making houses for ants because I thought they needed somewhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 兒時我常給螞蟻造房子，因爲我想它們也需要地方住。

sentences.english: Norrell, who was adopted from Mexico as a baby by a Californian family, had been in Antioch to attend a rehearsal for a friend's coming-of-age party.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒時的墨西哥女孩諾雷爾被加利福尼亞一家人收養。

sentences.english: Is the wind affecting every blade of grass in exactly the same manner at exactly the same time?
sentences.chinese: 風吹動草兒時每一棵草都是一樣運動的嗎？

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
(haven't done sth) for a long time/a long time since we last met
